tselva wrote:
> 
> Hi,
> I use JUnit to test methods that takes in object as its parameters.Now 
> for testing those methods I instantiate those input objects and set its 
> attributes in the test class before testing the test method. Is there 
> any way of constructing the objects at runtime from stubs (like XML 
> stubs), So that I need not hard code the object's attributes in my test 
> class.

There is a chapter in _JUnit Recipes_ that describes various techniques 
for moving test data out of the code and into external sources, like 
files or databases.

For isolated unit tests, though, it is generally better to have test 
data with the code. For heavily data-driven tests, integration tests or 
end-to-end tests, externalizing data might be a good idea.

Good luck.
--
